item.title: Deconvolution and the System Matrix
item.description: Delving into the practicalities of the inverse problem of reconstructing Compton camera images will lead you to Legandre polynomials or Maximum Likelihood methods, most likely. Since last week I have been interested in both the analytical reconstruction techniques as well as some of the iterative methods. Regarding iterative methods, what I found is that it is difficult to get a feeling on how the iterative methods properly work simply because the algorithms (I write mine in Python) is incredibly slow.
